name: hyperspectral_imaging
displayName: Hyperspectral Imaging

name: name
displayName: description

name: fileID
displayName: Primary key assigned automatically by DB (Do not edit)

name: directory
displayName: same as path to this sheet - assigned automatically (Do not edit)

name: uniqueFileName
displayName: automatically generated (equipment_analyte_stabilization_sampleType_lab_timestamp)

name: lab
displayName: name of the lab where the experiment was done

name: contact
displayName: Stable (ideally long-term) contact information for experimenter(s).

name: publication
displayName: associated publication data was published in (e.g. DOI)

name: acquisitionDate
displayName: Same as data of .mis file creation - assigned automatically

name: ionization
displayName: This just to make sure that we don't get other types of ionization

name: analyzer
displayName: Mass analyzer used (see drop down menu)

name: polarity
displayName: Polarity (see drop down menu)

name: equipment
displayName: choose one of ('autoflex', 'ultraflex', 'rapiflex', 'solarix','other')

name: acquisitionType
displayName: whole tissue or TMAs (drop down menu)

name: surfaceType
displayName: Surface analyzed or used as an underlying substrate for analysis (ITO, glass, metal)

name: surfaceMods
displayName: Was the surface analyzed modified in any way (functionalized, coated)?

name: analyte
displayName: analytes being imaged (small molecules, peptides, proteins, glycans, other)

name: minRange
displayName: Minimum m/z for the acquired mass range.

name: maxRange
displayName: Maximum m/z for the acquired mass range.

name: calType
displayName: Type of calibration employed (external, internal, lock mass).

name: calStandard
displayName: Calibration standard or standard mixture(s) used.

name: fixation
displayName: What stabilization method was used (dehydration, heat inactivation, alcohol/cross-linking fixation, freezing)?

name: embedding
displayName: Embedding method for sample (OCT, CMC, gelatin, paraffin, none).

name: microtome
displayName: (Cryo)-microtome instrument used to section material.

name: thickness
displayName: Tissue section thickness (µm)

name: wash
displayName: Wash or solution treatment for section(s) and/or surface(s) (fixation, re-hydration).

name: scan
displayName: Was sample / section scanned prior to analysis for co-registration?

name: matrixType
displayName: What compound or material was used to mediate ionization (2.5-DHB, DAN, THAP, HCCA, CLCCA, SDHB, DHAP, 9AA, other)?

name: matrixInstrument
displayName: Instrument used for matrix preparation (manual sprayer, ImagePrep, sublimation chamber, iMatrixSpray, TM-sprayer, sunChrome, M3, M5, other).

name: laserDiameter
displayName: Laser spot size, or measured area (µm).

name: laserPower
displayName: Laser power if known

name: laserRepRate
displayName: Laser repetition rate (kHz)

name: spatialRes
displayName: The size of the data pixels (spectra) [µm].

name: processing
displayName: List of the pre-processing steps / pipeline used on the raw data.

name: normalization
displayName: Method used for intensity normalization (none, TIC, RMS, ...).

name: sampleType
displayName: The type of sample (animal, clinical, geological)

name: multipleTissueTypesInFile
displayName: whether the slide contains multipe tissue types (ex. liver and kidney …)

name: tissueType
displayName: The name of the organ the tissue was taken from (liver, kidney, brain, stomach, intestine, skin lung, colon, abdomen, thoraxwall, peritoneum, pelvis, pancreas). For multiple entries use a comman for separation

name: condition
displayName: pathological condition: ex. diseased, wildtype, mutant, control, tumor, gist, glioblastoma, …

name: isTumor
displayName: is the sample an oncological specimen?

name: tissueSubType
displayName: optional - additional info about the tissue

name: comment
displayName: optional - comments

name: DatasetField
displayName: identifier
